newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: ABB to supply deepwater platform.
newsitem.headline: ABB to supply deepwater platform.

text.p: Electrical engineering group ABB Asea Brown Boveri AG said it had signed a turnkey agreement with Amoco Corp of the U.S. to build a tension leg platform (TLP) for the Marlin field of the Viosca Knoll area in the Gulf of Mexico.
The total contract is valued at around $300 million, ABB said in a statement.
This floating production platform will be tethered by tendons, or tension legs, to the sea bed at a depth of 3,240 feet.
Oil and gas production form the Marlin TLP is expected to come on stream in the second quarter of 1999.
The TLP facilities will be designed to produce 250 million standard cubic feet per day of natural gas and 40 thousand barrels of oil a day.

The contact is the first ever awarded to a single supplier to carry out all engineering, procurement, construction and installation of a TLP production facility and its associated pipelines, ABB said.
ABB will also supply the rise and tendon systems.
